is one of the major districts of northern
. It consists of Petaling Jaya's Sections 22 and 22A and is mainly a residential area dating from the mid 1970s. The main commercial area within Damansara Jaya is the Atria Shopping Centre.

value: By road via LDP, NKVE and Sprint highways.
By public transport via RapidKL train to Taman Bahagia and then connecting by bus.

content= This coffee-shop styled restaurant is well known for its selection of claypot rice dishes. Customers may choose from traditional chicken to prawn, fish or beef. Busy Corner also serves varieties of steamed soups.
address=80 Jalan SS 22/25, Damansara Jaya, 47400 Petaling Jaya
directions=Near to Dominos Pizza and adjacent to Cinta Ria.
phone=+60 17 871 7739 Irene Heow  and +60 16 294 8983 chef's phone
hours=Closed on Wednesdays. Lunch 11:30 to 2PM. Dinner 5:00 to 9:30PM

content=  This coffee-shop styled restaurant commenced business in January 2009 and serves excellent Kampar claypot chicken rice.  A selection of vegetables and steamed soups are also available. The claypot rice is cooked on charcoal stoves. It is not uncommon for most customers to enhance the flavour of the claypot rice by adding Chinese sausage and salted fish. The claypot chicken rice is very popular and the restaurant tends to be jam packed especially during weekends. The operator has relocated from a stall formerly based at the nearby Koon Kee coffee shop. However at times, the lady owner is very rude.
on Jalan SS 22/23. Halal restaurant near to Dr Kwan's clinic.
on Jalan SS 22/19. This location was formerly occupied by the Chef Rasa Sayang Restaurant.

on Jalan SS 22/19. Upmarket restaurant. Commenced business in May 2008. Branch of parent shop in Kuchai Lama.

on Jalan SS 22/25. Upmarket restaurant serving excellent Penang nyonya style dishes. Reputed to be a favourite of the late Datin Paduka Seri Endon Mahmood, wife of Malaysian Prime Minister Abdullah Badawi. The nyonya fish head curry was one dish she had particularly liked.
on the Ground floor of the Atria Complex. Has been on 3rd Floor since 1992. Shifted in September 2008 to former
location on Ground Floor (opposite Nando's). Serves tasty and affordably priced Malacca nyonya food.
on the Ground Floor of the Atria Complex. This is authentic Penang, for Chef Tang is from Tanjung Tokong.
address=22, Jalan SS22/21, Damansara Jaya, 47400 Petaling Jaya

content=Serves western and local food in a cosy friendly environment where "everybody knows your name". Bon-Bon is famous for its signature "durian cake", which for many tastes more delicious than the real fruit. Besides pastries, American breakfast and euro pancakes. Bon-Bon has a rotating menu of daily local specials including nasi lemak, laksa and noodles.

address=78, Jalan SS 22/25,
47400 Damansara Jaya, 47400 Petaling Jaya
directions=It’s just besides the Choong Kee Claypot Rice.

content=Cinta Ria is a halal restaurant that commenced business in Decemeber 2007. Serves breakfast from 8:30AM. Location was previously briefly occupied from April to September 2007 by the Chuan Hiong Bah Kut Teh restaurant.
address=32, Jalan SS22/21, Damansara Jaya, 47400 Petaling Jaya
directions=It’s just besides the Splash Gamuda.
content=The Mage Cafe is pork free and serves set lunch everyday. Quite affordable as lunch for 4 persons is just below 40 Ringgit. The owner is from Penang.
address=49 Jalan SS 22/23, Damansara Jaya, 4700 Petaling Jaya.
directions=On internal road, near to Atria side entrance. Same row as Gamuda office.
content= Commenced business in mid 2008. Closed during 2010.
content=Located at 21 Jalan SS 22/23. Commenced business in July 2008. Claims to have the cheapest Western food in town. The owner used to run the Western food stall in a coffee shop near KDU.

value: Basic fare including Malay and Chinese mixed rice are available from the 2 hawker centres located adjacent to the Jalan SS 22/19 and SS 22/25 car parks.

There are no inns, guest houses, motels or hotels in Damansara Jaya.
